info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 5:29PM MDT until August 07 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT/715 PM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN YUMA COUNTY IN NORTHEASTERN COLORADO...NORTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... SOUTHWESTERN CHEYENNE AND NORTHWESTERN SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 528 PM MDT/628 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bonny Reservoir, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported two inch hail along Highway 385 in southern Yuma county. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northeastern Kit Carson County in east central Colorado, southwestern Cheyenne and northwestern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Hale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 7 and 20. Highway 385 between mile markers 198 and 215. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
